preqs: Students must have passed ACF5904 or ACF5958, plus ACF5955.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACF5904, ACF5958} AND  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ACF5955})
Must be enrolled in course type {03, 04, 05, 06, 07, 11, 42, 50PG}
Must have passed 4 (I/W) units in {ACF5904, ACF5955, ACF5956, ACF5957, ACF5958}

description: Accounting is concerned with the provision, analysis and communication of information to stakeholders. Accountants record, summarise, classify, interpret and communicate both financial and non-financial information. In this capstone unit, students will consolidate their previous learning gained throughout the Master of Professional Accounting course and apply their skills and knowledge directly in a team-based environment. The unit aims to prepare students for an accounting and finance career path. Using a virtual integrated business environment, the unit showcases a thematic approach that allows the interaction of regulatory, economic, social, ethical and global perspectives.
